fotoshop.Filter

Class RotateFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • fotoshop.Filter.Filter
      • fotoshop.Filter.RotateFilter

  • public class RotateFilter
extends Filter
    Derived from the suggestions made in "Objects First with Java" by Michael Kolling and David Barnes, along with the methods used originally within the Editor class of the prototype Fotoshop project. * @author Benjamin Nicholls
    MonoFilter applies a 90 degree rotation to the image.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RotateFilter(java.lang.String name)
      Initialise the RotateFilter.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ColorImage applyFilter(ColorImage image)
      apply the RotateFilter, rotating 90 degrees
      ColorImage applyFilter(ColorImage image, float i)
      The default applyFilter method calls the applyFilter method i number of times

      • RotateFilter

        public RotateFilter(java.lang.String name)
        Initialise the RotateFilter.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to be given to the filter

    • Method Detail

      • applyFilter

        public ColorImage applyFilter(ColorImage image,
                     float i)
        The default applyFilter method calls the applyFilter method i number of times
        Overrides:
        applyFilter in class Filter
        Parameters:
        image - the image to be rotated
        i - the number of times to apply this filter. i=1 will rotate 90 degrees, i = 2 will rotate twice, rotating 180 degrees
        Returns:
        imageOut return a rotated duplicate of the param image

      • applyFilter

        public ColorImage applyFilter(ColorImage image)
        apply the RotateFilter, rotating 90 degrees
        Overrides:
        applyFilter in class Filter
        Parameters:
        image -
        Returns:
        ColorImage rotated 90 degrees
